question.text: Injection molding cooling typically accounts for what percentage of cycle time?
What is recovery time for a injection molding system?

answers.answer: Time required for an injection molding system to produce a part and return to its original position
Time required for a screw to rotate, create a shot, and return to its original position
Time required to bring barrel heater bands to proper temperature following a machine shut down

question.text: Which one of the following is a way to reduce part shrinkage during injection molding?
What four major factors must be controlled when troubleshooting molding processes?

answers.answer: Pressure, moisture, cooling rate, and temperature
Temperature, screw travel, back pressure, heating rate
Pressure, flowrate, cycle time, mold design

question.text: What are three possible causes of swelling or ballooning?

answers.answer: High melt temperature, excess moisture, shortened cooling time
Low injection speed, shortened cooling time, excessive back pressure
Excess moisture, insufficient material, low injection speed

question.text: Define "cycle time" as it applies to the injection molding process.

answers.answer: Time required for an injection molding system to make a part and return to its original state/position.
Amount of time needed to cool a molded part.
Time it takes the feedscrew to inject resin into the mold.

question.text: What four major factors can cause short shots?

answers.answer: High injection rate, excessive contamination, excess material, flow blockage
Lack of material, flow blockage, low injection pressure, excessive viscosity of material
Gas entrapment, excess material, flow blockage, mold surface irregularity

question.text: What three corrective actions can be taken to avoid silver streaks or spray during injection molding?

answers.answer: Increase process temperatures, reduce gate size, reduce injection speed
Dry material, reduce injection speed, check regrind for contaminants
Dry material, decrease gate size, reduce process temperature

question.text: What is the best solution for correcting gate blush?
What are three major causes of burn?

answers.answer: Low melt temperature, improper venting, moist compound
Inadequate cooling time, excessive melt temperature, low injection speed
Cooling mold, over-used regrind, low injection speed

question.text: On its way from the heating barrel to the mold cavity, the plastic must flow, in sequence through the
Which grade is suitable for plastic air intake manifold application?
What is the major advantage of Ultradur High Speed?
Which application is BASF promoting with Ultramid TOP 3000?

answers.answer: Automotive on-line paintable exterior body panels

question.text: Which grade did BASF successfully commercialization for lower bumper stiffener of GM-Opel Corsa?
What are the main advantages of Ultramid A3UG5 compared Ultramid A3X2G5?

answers.answer: Red phosphorous free, light color availability

question.text: If replace the metal by plastics based on same thickness, which metal replacement is in highest cost reduction?
Which grade can be used to replace the applications with MID (Molded Interconnected Devices) technology?
Which grade has better hydrolysis resistance in water contacting applications?
Which grade is better for baby bottle?
